member.name: T:S22.Pop3.Pop3Client
member.summary: Allows applications to communicate with a mail server by using the Post Office Protocol version 3 (POP3).

member.name: M:S22.Pop3.Pop3Client.#ctor(System.String,System.Int32,System.Boolean,System.Net.Security.RemoteCertificateValidationCallback)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the Pop3Client class and connects to the specified port on the specified host, optionally using the Secure Socket Layer (SSL) security protocol.
member.param: The DNS name of the server to which you intend to connect.
The port number of the server to which you intend to connect.
Set to true to use the Secure Socket Layer (SSL) security protocol.
Delegate used for verifying the remote Secure Sockets Layer (SSL) certificate which is used for authentication. Set this to null if not needed
member.exception: The port parameter is not between MinPort and MaxPort.
The hostname parameter is null.
An error occurred while accessing the socket used for establishing the connection to the POP3 server. Use the ErrorCode property to obtain the specific error code
An authentication error occured while trying to establish a secure connection.
Thrown if an unexpected response is received from the server upon connecting.

member.name: M:S22.Pop3.Pop3Client.#ctor(System.String,System.Int32,System.String,System.String,S22.Pop3.AuthMethod,System.Boolean,System.Net.Security.RemoteCertificateValidationCallback)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the Pop3Client class and connects to the specified port on the specified host, optionally using the Secure Socket Layer (SSL) security protocol and attempts to authenticate with the server using the specified authentication method and credentials.
member.param: The DNS name of the server to which you intend to connect.
The port number of the server to which you intend to connect.
The username with which to login in to the POP3 server.
The password with which to log in to the POP3 server.
The requested method of authentication. Can be one of the values of the AuthMethod enumeration.
Set to true to use the Secure Socket Layer (SSL) security protocol.
Delegate used for verifying the remote Secure Sockets Layer (SSL) certificate which is used for authentication. Set this to null if not needed
member.exception: The port parameter is not between MinPort and MaxPort.
The hostname parameter is null.
An error occurred while accessing the socket used for establishing the connection to the POP3 server. Use the ErrorCode property to obtain the specific error code
An authentication error occured while trying to establish a secure connection.
Thrown if an unexpected response is received from the server upon connecting.
Thrown if authentication using the supplied credentials failed.

member.name: M:S22.Pop3.Pop3Client.Connect(System.String,System.Int32,System.Boolean,System.Net.Security.RemoteCertificateValidationCallback)
member.summary: Connects to the specified port on the specified host, optionally using the Secure Socket Layer (SSL) security protocol.
member.param: The DNS name of the server to which you intend to connect.
The port number of the server to which you intend to connect.
Set to true to use the Secure Socket Layer (SSL) security protocol.
Delegate used for verifying the remote Secure Sockets Layer (SSL) certificate which is used for authentication. Set this to null if not needed
member.exception: The port parameter is not between MinPort and MaxPort.
The hostname parameter is null.
An error occurred while accessing the socket used for establishing the connection to the POP3 server. Use the ErrorCode property to obtain the specific error code.
An authentication error occured while trying to establish a secure connection.
Thrown if an unexpected response is received from the server upon connecting.

member.name: M:S22.Pop3.Pop3Client.IsResponseOK(System.String)
member.summary: Determines whether the received response is a valid POP3 OK response.
member.param: A response string received from the server
member.returns: True if the response is a valid POP3 OK response, otherwise false is returned.

member.name: M:S22.Pop3.Pop3Client.SendCommand(System.String)
member.summary: Sends a command string to the server. This method blocks until the command has been transmitted.
member.param: Command string to be sent to the server. The command string is suffixed by CRLF (as is required by the POP3 protocol) prior to sending.

member.name: M:S22.Pop3.Pop3Client.SendCommandGetResponse(System.String)
member.summary: Sends a command string to the server and subsequently waits for a response, which is then returned to the caller. This method blocks until the server response has been received.
member.param: Command string to be sent to the server. The command string is suffixed by CRLF (as is required by the POP3 protocol) prior to sending.
member.returns: The response received by the server.

member.name: M:S22.Pop3.Pop3Client.GetResponse
member.summary: Waits for a response from the server. This method blocks until a response has been received.
member.returns: A response string from the server

member.name: M:S22.Pop3.Pop3Client.Login(System.String,System.String,S22.Pop3.AuthMethod)
member.summary: Attempts to establish an authenticated session with the server using the specified credentials.
member.param: The username with which to login in to the POP3 server.
The password with which to log in to the POP3 server.
The requested method of authentication. Can be one of the values of the AuthMethod enumeration.
member.exception: Thrown if authentication using the supplied credentials failed.

member.name: M:S22.Pop3.Pop3Client.Logout
member.summary: Logs an authenticated client out of the server. After the logout sequence has been completed, the server closes the connection with the client.
member.exception: Thrown if an unexpected response is received from the server during the logout sequence
member.remarks: Calling Logout in a non-authenticated state has no effect

member.name: M:S22.Pop3.Pop3Client.Capabilities
member.summary: Returns a listing of capabilities that the POP3 server supports. All strings in the returned array are guaranteed to be upper-case.
member.exception: Thrown if the server does not support retrieving a list of its capabilities.
member.returns: A listing of supported capabilities as an array of strings
member.remarks: This is one of the few methods which can be called in a non-authenticated state. The command for retrieving a list of capabilities is an optional extension to the POP3 protocol, so not every server may support it.

member.name: M:S22.Pop3.Pop3Client.Supports(System.String)
member.summary: Returns whether the specified capability is supported by the server.
member.param: The capability to probe for (for example "IDLE")
member.exception: Thrown if an unexpected response is received from the server during the request. The message property of the exception contains the error message returned by the server.
Thrown if the server does not implement the underlying infrastructure the Supports method relies upon.
member.returns: Returns true if the specified capability is supported by the server, otherwise false is returned.

member.name: M:S22.Pop3.Pop3Client.GetStatus
member.summary: Retrieves status information (list of messages with message numbers as well as size for each message)
member.returns: An array of MessageInfo objects containing status information for the mailbox.
member.exception: Thrown if the method was called in a non-authenticated state, i.e. before logging into the server with valid credentials.
Thrown if the operation could not be completed. The message property of the exception contains the error message returned by the server.

member.name: M:S22.Pop3.Pop3Client.GetMessageNumbers
member.summary: Retrieves a list of message numbers of all mail messages in the mailbox.
member.returns: An array of message numbers representing the mail messages in the mailbox on the server.
member.exception: Thrown if the method was called in a non-authenticated state, i.e. before logging into the server with valid credentials.
Thrown if the operation could not be completed. The message property of the exception contains the error message returned by the server.

member.name: M:S22.Pop3.Pop3Client.GetMessage(System.UInt32,S22.Pop3.FetchOptions,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Retrieves a mail message from the POP3 server.
member.param: The message number of the mail message to retrieve
A value from the FetchOptions enumeration which allows for fetching selective parts of a mail message.
Set this to true to delete the message on the server after it has been retrieved.
member.exception: Thrown if the method was called in a non-authenticated state, i.e. before logging into the server with valid credentials.
Thrown if the mail message could not be retrieved. The message property of the exception contains the error message returned by the server.
member.returns: An initialized instance of the MailMessage class representing the fetched mail message

member.name: M:S22.Pop3.Pop3Client.GetMessages(System.UInt32[],S22.Pop3.FetchOptions,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Retrieves a set of mail messages. If no parameters are specified, all mail messages in the mailbox will be retrieved.
member.param: An array of message numbers of the mail messages to retrieve. If this parameter is null, all mail messages will be retrieved.
A value from the FetchOptions enumeration which allows for fetching selective parts of a mail message.
Set this to true to delete the messages on the server after they have been retrieved.
member.exception: Thrown if the method was called in a non-authenticated state, i.e. before logging into the server with valid credentials.
Thrown if the mail messages could not be fetched. The message property of the exception contains the error message returned by the server.
member.returns: An array of initialized instances of the MailMessage class representing the fetched mail messages

member.name: M:S22.Pop3.Pop3Client.DeleteMessage(System.UInt32)
member.summary: Deletes the mail message with the specified message number.
member.param: The message number of the mail message that is to be deleted.
member.exception: Thrown if the method was called in a non-authenticated state, i.e. before logging into the server with valid credentials.
Thrown if the mail message could not be deleted. The message property of the exception contains the error message returned by the server.

member.name: M:S22.Pop3.Pop3Client.Dispose
member.summary: Releases all resources used by this Pop3Client object.

member.name: P:S22.Pop3.Pop3Client.Authed
member.summary: Indicates whether the client is authenticated with the server

member.name: T:S22.Pop3.MessageBuilder
member.summary: A helper class for reading mail message data and building a MailMessage instance out of it.

member.name: M:S22.Pop3.MessageBuilder.FromHeader(System.String)
member.summary: Creates a new empty instance of the MailMessage class from a string containing a raw mail message header.
member.param: A string containing the mail header to create the MailMessage instance from.
member.returns: A MailMessage instance with initialized Header fields but no content

member.name: M:S22.Pop3.MessageBuilder.FromMIME822(System.String)
member.summary: Creates a new instance of the MailMessage class from a string containing raw RFC822/MIME mail message data.
member.param: A string containing the mail message data to create the MailMessage instance from.
member.returns: An initialized instance of the MailMessage class.
member.remarks: This is used when fetching entire messages instead of the partial-fetch mechanism because it saves redundant round-trips to the server.

member.name: M:S22.Pop3.MessageBuilder.ParseMailHeader(System.String)
member.summary: Parses the mail header of a mail message and returns it as a NameValueCollection.
member.param: The mail header to parse.
member.returns: A NameValueCollection containing the header fields as keys with their respective values as values.

member.name: M:S22.Pop3.MessageBuilder.ParseMIMEField(System.String)
member.summary: Parses a MIME header field which can contain multiple 'parameter = value' pairs (such as Content-Type: text/html; charset=iso-8859-1).
member.param: The header field to parse
member.returns: A NameValueCollection containing the parameter names as keys with the respective parameter values as values.
member.remarks: The value of the actual field disregarding the 'parameter = value' pairs is stored in the collection under the key "value" (in the above example of Content-Type, this would be "text/html").

member.name: M:S22.Pop3.MessageBuilder.ParseAddressList(System.String)
member.summary: Parses a mail header address-list field such as To, Cc and Bcc which can contain multiple email addresses.
member.param: The address-list field to parse
member.returns: An array of MailAddress objects representing the parsed mail addresses.

member.name: M:S22.Pop3.MessageBuilder.ParseMessageId(System.String)
member.summary: Parses a mail message identifier from a string.
member.param: The field to parse the message id from
member.exception: Thrown when the field argument does not contain a valid message identifier.
member.returns: The parsed message id
member.remarks: A message identifier (msg-id) is a globally unique identifier for a message.

member.name: M:S22.Pop3.MessageBuilder.ParsePriority(System.String)
member.summary: Parses the priority of a mail message which can be specified as part of the header information.
member.param: The mail header priority value. The value can be null in which case a "normal priority" is returned.
member.returns: A value from the MailPriority enumeration corresponding to the specified mail priority. If the passed priority value is null or invalid, a normal priority is assumed and MailPriority.Normal is returned.

member.name: M:S22.Pop3.MessageBuilder.SetAddressFields(System.Net.Mail.MailMessage,System.Collections.Specialized.NameValueCollection)
member.summary: Sets the address fields (From, To, CC, etc.) of a MailMessage object using the specified mail message header information.
member.param: The MailMessage instance to operate on
A collection of mail and MIME headers

member.name: M:S22.Pop3.MessageBuilder.AddBodypart(System.Net.Mail.MailMessage,S22.Pop3.Bodypart,System.String)
member.summary: Adds a body part to an existing MailMessage instance.
member.param: Extension method for the MailMessage class.
The body part to add to the MailMessage instance.
The content of the body part.

member.name: M:S22.Pop3.MessageBuilder.CreateAttachment(S22.Pop3.Bodypart,System.Byte[])
member.summary: Creates an instance of the Attachment class used by the MailMessage class to store mail message attachments.
member.param: The MIME body part to create the attachment from.
An array of bytes composing the content of the attachment
member.returns: An initialized instance of the Attachment class

member.name: M:S22.Pop3.MessageBuilder.CreateAlternateView(S22.Pop3.Bodypart,System.Byte[])
member.summary: Creates an instance of the AlternateView class used by the MailMessage class to store alternate views of the mail message's content.
member.param: The MIME body part to create the alternate view from.
An array of bytes composing the content of the alternate view
member.returns: An initialized instance of the AlternateView class

member.name: M:S22.Pop3.MessageBuilder.ParseMailBody(System.String,System.Collections.Specialized.NameValueCollection)
member.summary: Parses the body part of a MIME/RFC822 mail message.
member.param: The body of the mail message.
The header of the mail message whose body will be parsed.
member.returns: An array of initialized MIMEPart instances representing the body parts of the mail message.

member.name: M:S22.Pop3.MessageBuilder.ParseMIMEParts(System.IO.StringReader,System.String)
member.summary: Parses the body of a multipart MIME mail message.
member.param: An instance of the StringReader class initialized with a string containing the body of the mail message.
The boundary value as is present as part of the Content-Type header field in multipart mail messages.
member.returns: An array of initialized MIMEPart instances representing the various parts of the MIME mail message.

member.name: M:S22.Pop3.MessageBuilder.BodypartFromMIME(S22.Pop3.MIMEPart)
member.summary: Glue method to create a bodypart from a MIMEPart instance.
member.param: The MIMEPart instance to create the bodypart instance from.
member.returns: An initialized instance of the Bodypart class.

member.name: T:S22.Pop3.ContentType
member.summary: Possible values for the "Type" property of the Bodypart class. For a detailed description of MIME Media Types refer to RFC 2046.

member.name: F:S22.Pop3.ContentType.Text
member.summary: The "text" media type is intended for sending material which is principally textual in form.

member.name: F:S22.Pop3.ContentType.Image
member.summary: A media type of "image" indicates that the body contains an image. The subtype names the specific image format.

member.name: F:S22.Pop3.ContentType.Audio
member.summary: A media type of "audio" indicates that the body contains audio data.

member.name: F:S22.Pop3.ContentType.Video
member.summary: A media type of "video" indicates that the body contains a time-varying-picture image, possibly with color and coordinated sound.

member.name: F:S22.Pop3.ContentType.Application
member.summary: The "application" media type is to be used for discrete data which do not fit in any of the other categories, and particularly for data to be processed by some type of application program.

member.name: F:S22.Pop3.ContentType.Message
member.summary: The "message" content type allows messages to contain other messages or pointers to other messages.

member.name: F:S22.Pop3.ContentType.Other
member.summary: The media type value is unknown or could not be determined.

member.name: T:S22.Pop3.Bodypart
member.summary: Represents a MIME body part of a mail message that has multiple parts.

member.name: M:S22.Pop3.Bodypart.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the Bodypart class with default values.
member.param: The part number as is expected by the IMAP FETCH command.

member.name: M:S22.Pop3.Bodypart.ToString
member.summary: Returns a detailed description listing all properties of this Bodypart instance.
member.returns: A string describing this instance of the Bodypart class

member.name: P:S22.Pop3.Bodypart.PartNumber
member.summary: The body part number which acts as part specifier for the FETCH BODY command.

member.name: P:S22.Pop3.Bodypart.Type
member.summary: The MIME content-type of this body part. The content-type is used to declare the general type of data.

member.name: P:S22.Pop3.Bodypart.Subtype
member.summary: The MIME content-subtype of this body part. The subtype specifies a specific format for the type of data.

member.name: P:S22.Pop3.Bodypart.Parameters
member.summary: Parameter values present in the MIME content-type header of this body part (for instance, 'charset').

member.name: P:S22.Pop3.Bodypart.Id
member.summary: The MIME content-id of this body part, if any. This value may be used for uniquely identifying MIME entities in several contexts.

member.name: P:S22.Pop3.Bodypart.Description
member.summary: The MIME content-description of this body part. This value may contain some descriptive information on the body part.

member.name: P:S22.Pop3.Bodypart.Encoding
member.summary: The MIME content-transfer-encoding mechanism used for encoding this body part's data.

member.name: P:S22.Pop3.Bodypart.Size
member.summary: The size of this body part in bytes. Note that this size is the size in its transfer encoding and not the resulting size after any decoding.

member.name: P:S22.Pop3.Bodypart.Lines
member.summary: The size of the body in text lines. This field is only present in body parts with a content-type of text.

member.name: P:S22.Pop3.Bodypart.Md5
member.summary: The computed MD5-Hash of the body part. This field is not mandatory and may be empty.

member.name: P:S22.Pop3.Bodypart.Disposition
member.summary: The MIME content-disposition for this body part. This field is not mandatory and may be empty.

member.name: P:S22.Pop3.Bodypart.Language
member.summary: A string giving the body language. This field is not mandatory and may be empty.

member.name: P:S22.Pop3.Bodypart.Location
member.summary: A string list giving the body content URI. This field is not mandatory and may be empty.

member.name: T:S22.Pop3.Util
member.summary: A static utility class containing methods for decoding encoded non-ASCII data as is often used in mail messages as well as extension methods for some existing classes.

member.name: M:S22.Pop3.Util.IsASCII(System.String)
member.summary: Returns true if the string contains only ASCII characters.
member.param: Extension method for the String class.
member.returns: Returns true if the string contains only ASCII characters, otherwise false is returned.

member.name: M:S22.Pop3.Util.DecodeWords(System.String)
member.summary: Decodes a string composed of one or several MIME 'encoded-words'.
member.param: A string to composed of one or several MIME 'encoded-words'
member.exception: Thrown when an unknown encoding (other than Q-Encoding or Base64) is encountered.
member.returns: A concatenation of all enconded-words in the passed string

member.name: M:S22.Pop3.Util.DecodeWord(System.String)
member.summary: Decodes a MIME 'encoded-word' string.
member.param: The encoded word to decode
member.exception: Thrown when an unknown encoding (other than Q-Encoding or Base64) is encountered.
member.returns: A decoded string
member.remarks: MIME encoded-word syntax is a way to encode strings that contain non-ASCII data. Commonly used encodings for the encoded-word sytax are Q-Encoding and Base64. For an in-depth description, refer to RFC 2047

member.name: M:S22.Pop3.Util.QDecode(System.String,System.Text.Encoding)
member.summary: Takes a Q-encoded string and decodes it using the specified encoding.
member.param: The Q-encoded string to decode
The encoding to use for encoding the returned string
member.exception: Thrown if the string is not a valid Q-encoded string.
member.returns: A Q-decoded string

member.name: M:S22.Pop3.Util.QPDecode(System.String,System.Text.Encoding)
member.summary: Takes a quoted-printable encoded string and decodes it using the specified encoding.
member.param: The quoted-printable-encoded string to decode
The encoding to use for encoding the returned string
member.exception: Thrown if the string is not a valid quoted-printable encoded string.
member.returns: A quoted-printable decoded string

member.name: M:S22.Pop3.Util.Base64Decode(System.String)
member.summary: Takes a Base64-encoded string and decodes it.
member.param: The Base64-encoded string to decode
member.returns: A byte array containing the Base64-decoded bytes of the input string.

member.name: M:S22.Pop3.Util.GetEncoding(System.String)
member.summary: This just wraps Encoding.GetEncoding in a try-catch block to ensure it never fails. If the encoding can not be determined ASCII is returned as a default.
member.param: The code page name of the preferred encoding. Any value returned by System.Text.Encoding.WebName is a valid input.
member.returns: The System.Text.Encoding associated with the specified code page or Encoding.ASCII if the specified code page could not be resolved.

member.name: T:S22.Pop3.FetchOptions
member.summary: Fetch options that can be used with the GetMessage and GetMessages methods to selectively retrieve parts of a mail message while skipping others.

member.name: F:S22.Pop3.FetchOptions.Normal
member.summary: Fetches the entire mail message with all of its content.

member.name: F:S22.Pop3.FetchOptions.HeadersOnly
member.summary: Only the mail message headers will be retrieved, while the actual content will not be downloaded. If this option is specified, only the header fields of the returned MailMessage object will be initialized.

member.name: T:S22.Pop3.BadServerResponseException
member.summary: The exception is thrown when an unexpected response is received from the server.

member.name: M:S22.Pop3.BadServerResponseException.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the BadServerResponseException class

member.name: M:S22.Pop3.BadServerResponseException.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the BadServerResponseException class with its message string set to .
member.param: A description of the error. The content of message is intended to be understood by humans.

member.name: M:S22.Pop3.BadServerResponseException.#ctor(System.String,System.Exception)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the BadServerResponseException class with its message string set to and a reference to the inner exception that is the cause of this exception.
member.param: A description of the error. The content of message is intended to be understood by humans.
The exception that is the cause of the current exception.

member.name: M:S22.Pop3.BadServerResponseException.#ctor(System.Runtime.Serialization.SerializationInfo,System.Runtime.Serialization.StreamingContext)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the BadServerResponseException class with the specified serialization and context information.
member.param: An object that holds the serialized object data about the exception being thrown.
An object that contains contextual information about the source or destination.

member.name: T:S22.Pop3.InvalidCredentialsException
member.summary: This exception is thrown when the supplied credentials in a login attempt were rejected by the server.

member.name: M:S22.Pop3.InvalidCredentialsException.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the InvalidCredentialsException class

member.name: M:S22.Pop3.InvalidCredentialsException.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the InvalidCredentialsException class with its message string set to .
member.param: A description of the error. The content of message is intended to be understood by humans.

member.name: M:S22.Pop3.InvalidCredentialsException.#ctor(System.String,System.Exception)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the InvalidCredentialsException class with its message string set to and a reference to the inner exception that is the cause of this exception.
member.param: A description of the error. The content of message is intended to be understood by humans.
The exception that is the cause of the current exception.

member.name: M:S22.Pop3.InvalidCredentialsException.#ctor(System.Runtime.Serialization.SerializationInfo,System.Runtime.Serialization.StreamingContext)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the InvalidCredentialsException class with the specified serialization and context information.
member.param: An object that holds the serialized object data about the exception being thrown.
An object that contains contextual information about the source or destination.

member.name: T:S22.Pop3.NotAuthenticatedException
member.summary: This exception is thrown when a client has not authenticated with the server and attempts to call a method which can only be called in an authenticated context.

member.name: M:S22.Pop3.NotAuthenticatedException.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the NotAuthenticatedException class

member.name: M:S22.Pop3.NotAuthenticatedException.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the NotAuthenticatedException class with its message string set to .
member.param: A description of the error. The content of message is intended to be understood by humans.

member.name: M:S22.Pop3.NotAuthenticatedException.#ctor(System.String,System.Exception)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the NotAuthenticatedException class with its message string set to and a reference to the inner exception that is the cause of this exception.
member.param: A description of the error. The content of message is intended to be understood by humans.
The exception that is the cause of the current exception.

member.name: M:S22.Pop3.NotAuthenticatedException.#ctor(System.Runtime.Serialization.SerializationInfo,System.Runtime.Serialization.StreamingContext)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the NotAuthenticatedException class with the specified serialization and context information.
member.param: An object that holds the serialized object data about the exception being thrown.
An object that contains contextual information about the source or destination.

member.name: T:S22.Pop3.ContentTransferEncoding
member.summary: Possible values for the "Encoding" property of the Bodypart class. The content transfer encoding indicates whether or not a binary-to-text encoding scheme has been used on top of the original encoding as specified within the Content-Type header.

member.name: F:S22.Pop3.ContentTransferEncoding.Unknown
member.summary: The content tranfer encoding could not be determined or is unknown.

member.name: F:S22.Pop3.ContentTransferEncoding.Bit7
member.summary: Up to 998 bytes per line of the code range 1 - 127 with CR and LF only allowed to appear as part of a CRLF line ending.

member.name: F:S22.Pop3.ContentTransferEncoding.Bit8
member.summary: Up to 998 bytes per line with CR and LF only allowed to appear as part of a CRLF line ending.

member.name: F:S22.Pop3.ContentTransferEncoding.Binary
member.summary: Any sequence of bytes.

member.name: F:S22.Pop3.ContentTransferEncoding.QuotedPrintable
member.summary: Byte sequence is encoded using the quoted-printable encoding.

member.name: F:S22.Pop3.ContentTransferEncoding.Base64
member.summary: Byte sequence is encoded using Base64 encoding.

member.name: T:S22.Pop3.AuthMethod
member.summary: Defines supported means of authenticating with the POP3 server.

member.name: F:S22.Pop3.AuthMethod.Login
member.summary: Login using plaintext username/password authentication. This is the default supported by most servers.

member.name: F:S22.Pop3.AuthMethod.CRAMMD5
member.summary: Login using the CRAM-MD5 authentication mechanism.

member.name: F:S22.Pop3.AuthMethod.SaslOAuth
member.summary: Login using the OAuth authentication mechanism over the Simple Authentication and Security Layer (Sasl).

member.name: T:S22.Pop3.MessageInfo
member.summary: Describes status information of a mail message.

member.name: P:S22.Pop3.MessageInfo.Number
member.summary: The message number of this mail message.

member.name: P:S22.Pop3.MessageInfo.Size
member.summary: The size of this mail message, in bytes.

member.name: T:S22.Pop3.MIMEPart
member.summary: Represents a part of a MIME multi-part message. Each part consists of its own content header and a content body.

member.name: P:S22.Pop3.MIMEPart.header
member.summary: A collection containing the content header information as key-value pairs.

member.name: P:S22.Pop3.MIMEPart.body
member.summary: A string containing the content body of the part.

member.name: T:S22.Pop3.ContentDisposition
member.summary: Represents the content disposition as is presented in the BODYSTRUCTURE response by the IMAP server.

member.name: M:S22.Pop3.ContentDisposition.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the ContentDisposition class with default values.

member.name: F:S22.Pop3.ContentDisposition.Map
member.summary: Maps MIME content disposition string values to their corresponding counter-parts of the ContentDispositionType enumeration.

member.name: P:S22.Pop3.ContentDisposition.Type
member.summary: The content disposition specifies the presentation style.

member.name: P:S22.Pop3.ContentDisposition.Attributes
member.summary: Additional attribute fields for specifying the name of a file, the creation date and modification date, which can be used by the reader's mail user agent to store the attachment.

member.name: P:S22.Pop3.ContentDisposition.Filename
member.summary: Contains the name of the transmitted file if the content-disposition is of type "Attachment" and if the name value was provided as part of the header information. This field may be empty.

member.name: T:S22.Pop3.ContentDispositionType
member.summary: Possible values for the content disposition type which determines the presentation style

member.name: F:S22.Pop3.ContentDispositionType.Unknown
member.summary: The content disposition could not be determined.

member.name: F:S22.Pop3.ContentDispositionType.Inline
member.summary: An inline content disposition means that the content should be automatically displayed when the message is displayed.

member.name: F:S22.Pop3.ContentDispositionType.Attachment
member.summary: An attachment content disposition means that the content should not be displayed automatically and requires some form of action from the user to open it.
